intro: Gilberta tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf gilberta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, with a distinctive grayish-green color. Gilberta tenuifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
